meanings.definition: A brief, high-pitched sound or signal.
meanings.sent1: I heard a blipping noise coming from the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The blipping of the alarm clock woke me up.
meanings.sent3: The blipping of the microwave timer made me hungry.
meanings.sent4: The blipping of the sonar indicated the presence of fish.
meanings.sent5: The blipping of the radar warned of an incoming storm.

meanings.definition: To make a brief, high-pitched sound or signal.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys blipping the car horn when she's impatient.
meanings.sent2: The bird blipping its wings caught my attention.
meanings.sent3: He likes blipping the remote control to find the lost channel.
meanings.sent4: The musician blipping the keyboard added a unique touch to the song.
meanings.sent5: The machine blipping rhythmically indicated it was working properly.

meanings.definition: A small, temporary change or fluctuation.
meanings.sent1: There was a blipping in the stock market before it stabilized.
meanings.sent2: The blipping in the temperature made everyone reach for their jackets.
meanings.sent3: The blipping in the music volume surprised the audience.
meanings.sent4: The blipping in the heart rate monitor caused concern.
meanings.sent5: The blipping in the internet connection interrupted the video call.

meanings.definition: To make a small, temporary change or fluctuation.
meanings.sent1: The artist blipping the colors on the canvas created a beautiful effect.
meanings.sent2: The wind blipping the curtains gave the room a lively feel.
meanings.sent3: She was blipping the settings on the thermostat to find the right temperature.
meanings.sent4: The chef blipping the seasoning in the dish enhanced the flavor.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic blipping the engine settings improved the car's performance.
